recipe.name: Crispy Couscous Pancake with Tomato & Onion
recipe.description: A fabulous way to prepare couscous - everyone loves the crunchy burnt bits!
recipeIngredient: 1 tsp vegetable stock powder (or chicken stock powder, or just salt)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine couscous, stock powder (or salt) and water. Cover with cling wrap and put aside for 10 minutes, then fluff with a fork.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine couscous, stock powder (or salt) and water. Cover with cling wrap and put aside for 10 minutes, then fluff with a fork.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a pan about 20cm wide over medium heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a pan about 20cm wide over medium heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the onion and sauté until translucent and soft, but not browned - about 3 to 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the onion and sauté until translucent and soft, but not browned - about 3 to 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add tomato paste and sugar and stir for 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add tomato paste and sugar and stir for 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the diced tomatoes, salt and black pepper and cook for 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the diced tomatoes, salt and black pepper and cook for 3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the tomato mixture and couscous, and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the tomato mixture and couscous, and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Wipe the pan (you don't need to clean it thoroughly), then heat the remaining 2tbsp olive oil over medium heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Wipe the pan (you don't need to clean it thoroughly), then heat the remaining 2tbsp olive oil over medium heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the couscous mixture, using the back of a spoon to press the mixture firmly and evenly into the pan. The firmer you press it in, the better it will hold together.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the couscous mixture, using the back of a spoon to press the mixture firmly and evenly into the pan. The firmer you press it in, the better it will hold together.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover (even with a lid for a larger pot is fine) and leave for 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover (even with a lid for a larger pot is fine) and leave for 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from heat, loosen the edges slightly with a knife, put a plate on top, say a prayer, then flip quickly to invert the couscous pancake onto a plate with the crispy side up.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from heat, loosen the edges slightly with a knife, put a plate on top, say a prayer, then flip quickly to invert the couscous pancake onto a plate with the crispy side up.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve warm while it is nice and crispy!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve warm while it is nice and crispy!
